result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric A. NEWCOMER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence presently being served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on WRIT.
GUILTY plea entered to count 1, fleeing an officer.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, OAR.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to thirty (30) days jail, under the Huber Law, consecutive to any sentence presently being served.
Court costs are waived.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Plea Date on 03-26-2015 @ 4:00 p.m.
Copy filed.
Plea Date scheduled for 03-26-2015 @ 4:00 p.m. BR-1.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody on probation hold.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 02-12-15 at 2:00 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Information.
Minutes.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 02-04-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail not furnished, defendant refused to sign bond.  Commitment for failure to furnish bond issued.  Copy filed.  
Mintues.

RE:  Fleeing an officer, on 12-09-14.
Initial appearance is set for 01-26-15 at 9:30 a.m.
